results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.

results.title: About nothing = O nicem
results.creator_credit: William Bukovy, Jan Brychta, Pavel Hobl, Vlastimil Brodsky, Kratky Film and Vstredni Pujcouna Film
results.brief_description: An unusual animated story about a character called “Nothing”, that teases the mind in a delightful and challenging way. “Nothing” gets into the most difficult situations but - after finding a job in a circus he discovers he can successfully help the sad clown and others become happy and able to make fun again. Note: Czechoslovakian language - no subtitles.

results.title: Portland beef carcase competition 1960
results.brief_description: Promotional film highlighting the quality of Victorian beef. Shots of people looking at meat, etc throughout. Includes disturbing footage of beef carcases being hung. Great ‘The End’ title. See Also: 1955 Pig Carcase Competition at Dandenong and 1957 Pig Carcase Competition at Dandenong.

results.title: About flowers
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, Frank Spiller and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A nature lesson taught in a field of flowers. Two children playing in a meadow learn from an elderly neighbour about the recurring growth cycle of the flowering plant. They see how and why flowers attract bees, how fertilisation occurs, how seeds form and new plants come to life in spring. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Pleuro
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Ann Millard and Jack Keane
results.brief_description:
Film made to alert farmers of Pleuro-Pneoumonia, a nothern-state illness that could cripple local cattle if it was introduced into Victoria. Details how the illness manifests itself in cattle, its symptoms and how it is treated. Also describes the process of quarantine if Pleuro is suspected.

Uses diagramatical animations and illustrations throughout. These feature an animated map of Australia and Victoria. Numerous shots of cattle in hot and dry conditions. Amongst other bloody imagery there is footage of organs being removed from diseased cow and placed in a tin. Nice cheesey sequence of quarantine signs being placed around a property. Good ‘The End’ title.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Ann Millard and Jack Keane

results.title: 1957 Pig Carcase Competition
results.brief_description: Details and promotes the 1957 Pig Carcase competition as well as pork production in Victoria as a whole. Similar to the 1955 Pig Carcase competition in format and style. Includes various shots of carcases being cut for display, general crowd shots, an awards ceremony and a speech by an official. Features fantastic footage of three carcases hanging up in front of a black backdrop being inspected and caressed by a man. Nice theatrical quality to it. Excellent shot of a boy inspecting pork shot from behind, highlighting very cute jeans. End of piece features an official from the Board of Meat, aided by illustrations, talking about how pork production in Victoria has improved over time. Behind him hang carcases and behind them there is a red wall. He wears a pink and red tie. This creates a quirky, very good-looking frame of man, meat and pig illustration. Soundtrack features music of the period and earnest narration about ‘pig raisers’.

results.title: Agricultural Collection
results.brief_description:
From the 1940s, the Department of Agriculture’s Film and Video Unit produced film and later video. When this unit was closed, the film and video masters and raw footage were passed to Agmedia. Agmedia produced a range of videos, principally on behalf of the Department until 1996 when it was closed. Ownership of its films and videos (including copyright) reverted to the Department of Natural Resources and Environment (the successor agency to the Department of Agriculture).
The Department of Agriculture’s Head Office Library also operated a film lending service. This was closed in 1993 and their collection of 200+ 16mm films plus videos was placed in storage.
In 1997, following the relocation of the DRNE, the collection was passed to Cinemedia for short-term storage (in controlled atmosphere) for a nominal fee. The collection consisting of 1804 film titles and over 2,000 videos, included:
· The pre 1990 Film and Video Unit master tapes and raw footage;
· The Agmedia masters and raw footage (around 750 films and tapes); and
· The library collection of 16mm films and videos
From many perspectives, this is an important collection, not just because it records Victoria’s agricultural heritage, but also because many of our filmmakers learnt their craft in making these films. There are treasures to be uncovered in the camera original footage.

results.title: [Agnotes Advertisement: 4]
results.brief_description:
Victoria’s Department of Agriculture (now Agriculture Victoria) produced Agnotes, a series of reference material for the industry with the aim to disseminate expert advise for best agricultural practices.

This advertisement was designed to increase the uptake of the Agnotes by farmers. It is one of many commercials produced for the Department of Agriculture.

results.title: A Working holiday
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
